Mieke may not be great at solving problems

For example, with her career she often asks me how to get to a certain point – eg. what do I think is required to get this position, should she include a recommendation etc.

That's good! Seeking out help is a strength. But it works best if balanced (Balance researching and thinking for causal models, Balance searching for and making your own solutions).

I think it's important to put in effort trying to understand problems before you seek help. This allows you to practice your own problem solving; to better understand the problem and therefore to be more likely to find a suitable solution.

I don't feel Mieke has always done that; sometimes she just hands off a problem, or even just a symptom, expecting a solution. I'd love for her to get better at Define the problem first.

She is also more likely to use social consensus as an indicator of truth.

However, her surface area for problem solving (ie. where she might acquire experience) is also much smaller than mine, probably since Mieke has few interests.
